info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 12 at 6:29PM MST until October 12 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
FFWTWC
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Pima County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 900 PM MST.
* At 629 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Over the last 3 hours multiple rain gauges have recored 1 to 1.5 inches of rain.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tucson, Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, Tanque Verde, Saguaro National Park East and Rita Ranch.
This includes Interstate 10 near mile marker 269.
This includes the following Flash Flood Prone Locations... Harrison Rd at Pantano Wash, Old Spanish Trl at Rincon Creek, Escalante Rd at Atterbury Wash and Freeman Rd between Broadway and Old Spanish Trail.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Santa Cruz River, Tanque Verde Wash, Chico, Arroyo, Rincon Creek and Pantano Wash.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 9:00 PM MST. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 9:00 PM MST. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 9:00 PM MST. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 9:00 PM MST. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
